meanings.definition: A misheard or misinterpreted word or phrase in a song or poem.
meanings.sent1: The child thought 'purple haze' was a mondegreen for 'purple days'.
meanings.sent2: She realized her mondegreen when she sang 'Hold me closer, Tony Danza' instead of 'Hold me closer, tiny dancer'.
meanings.sent3: The mondegreen 'Scuse me while I kiss this guy' always makes me chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her mondegreen of 'I'm blue, if I was green I would die' painted a vivid picture in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The mondegreen 'The ants are my friends, they're blowing in the wind' stuck with her for years.

meanings.definition: To mishear or misinterpret a word or phrase in a song or poem.
meanings.sent1: He would often mondegreen lyrics, turning 'Billie Jean is not my lover' into 'Billy cheese is not my lover'.
meanings.sent2: She tends to mondegreen when she's singing along to songs on the radio.
meanings.sent3: Trying to mondegreen intentionally can lead to some hilarious results.
meanings.sent4: His mind would mondegreen words effortlessly, creating a world of his own.
meanings.sent5: She didn't realize she would mondegreen 'Sweet dreams are made of cheese' until her friend pointed it out.
